page.title: 04GIFFARDS JUNIOR SCHOOL
page.content: IN 1956 THE COUNCIL DECIDED THAT THEY NEEDED A NEW SCHOOL.SO THEY BUILT IT.MR SPENCER WAS HEADMASTER AT HERD LANE AND WAS GOING TO BE AT THE NEW SCHOOL.HE CALLED IT{GIFFARDS}BECAUSE THE{NORMANS}OWNED THE LAND AND ONE WAS CALLED GIFFARDS. WHEN THEY MOVED IN, THERE WERE 8 CLASSES, 42 IN A CLASS,330 IN THE SCHOOL.THE INFANTS HAD THE GROUND FLOOR BECAUSE THEIR SCHOOL HAD NOT BEEN BUILT YET. IN 1960 MR. ADAMS WAS HEAD MASTER,THEN IN 197I MR THOMAS BECAME HEADMASTER.HE RETIRED IN 1983.NOW WE HAVE 14 CLASSES ,FIVE YEARS AGO WE HAD 23 CLASSES.MR CALLAGHAN IS OUR HEADMASTER AT THE MOMENT.
